Senior Technical Fellow - AI and Data Architect - Advanced Technology (Onsite)

HIA32: Cedar Rapids, IA 400 Collins Rd NE , Cedar Rapids, IA, 52498-0505 USA, United States

Full Time Senior-level / Expert Clearance required USD 176K - 352K

RTX

At RTX, we're accelerating ideas to solve some of the world's biggest challenges by bringing together the brightest, most innovative minds across aviation, space and defense.

Date Posted:

2025-01-13

Country:

United States of America

Location:

HIA32: Cedar Rapids, IA 400 Collins Rd NE , Cedar Rapids, IA, 52498-0505 USA

Position Role Type:

Onsite

Do you want to be a part of something bigger? A team whose impact stretches across the world, and even beyond? At Collins Aerospace, our Mission Systems team helps civilian, military and government customers complete their most complex missions â€” whatever and wherever they may be. Our customers depend on us for intelligent and secure communications, missionized systems for specialized aircraft and spacecraft and collaborative space solutions. By joining our team, youâ€™ll have your own critical part to play in ensuring our customer succeeds today while anticipating their needs for tomorrow. Are you up for the challenge? Join our mission today.

Senior Technical Fellow - AI and Data Architect - Advanced Technology (Onsite)

At Collins Aerospace, weâ€™re working side-by-side with our customers and partners to dream, design and deliver solutions that redefine the future of our industry.â€¯ Weâ€™re reaching across markets, disciplines and boundaries to develop new and more advanced technologies. And, together, weâ€™re making the most powerful concepts in aerospace a reality.Â 

Â 

Join our dynamic team as a Senior Technical Fellow within Advanced Technology & Capabilities organization. This individual will lead strategic roadmap development and work closely with cross-functional leaders to drive innovation, build team cohesion and understand how to influence teams to make value added changes and develop a positive culture of continuous improvement.â€¯ With a strong business acumen to effectively communicate andâ€¯influence executive leadership, this prestigious role offers the opportunity to showcase your technical proficiency in Data & AI and supports the entire Connected Battlespace Strategic Initiative.Â 

Â 

The Senior Technical Fellow will own the establishment and execution of medium-term to long-term strategic roadmaps, plans, objectives, vision statements that align technology, customer (DOD) needs and create the opportunities for our future business.â€¯ This person must demonstrate a profound technical proficiency along with exceptional communication and presentation skills, as they play a pivotal role in shaping and influencing the business strategy which requires both depth and breadth in key technologies.â€¯Â 

Â 

As a key engineering member, in conjunction with the General Managers and Business Development leads, the Senior Technical Fellow will develop the strategies in Data & AI required to enable pursuits and capture growth via strategic roadmaps.â€¯ This visionary role entails aligning with customer needs and shaping/influencing future requirements of the Department of Defense (DoD).Â  The Senior Technical Fellow will leverage expertise in Data & AI to drive strategic decision-making integrating advanced technologies to enhance mission effectiveness and develop innovative solutions to complex defense operational problems for the Connected Battlespace Strategic Initiative.Â 

Â 

Another key aspect of this role involves providing enterprise mentorship to engineering disciplines, where other Technical Directors and Chief Engineers will seek council and guidance from the ATC Senior Technical Fellow.â€¯ This will enable the sharing of knowledge, drive quality and create new solutions.â€¯ The Senior Technical Fellow will be the primary advocate for integrating AI solutions into JADC2 systems and processes and will influence the larger business with Non-Advocate Reviews, Design Reviews, and Customer Technical alignment.â€¯Â 

Â 

This accomplished Technical Fellow will actively engage in other RTX business units and will be recognized for their technical expertise internally and externally to Collins.â€¯ The successful candidate will become part of the prestigious Fellows Program.â€¯ Collins Aerospace Fellows serve as leaders, technical experts, innovators,â€¯and mentors for our company. They represent the top of our technical career ladder and play a unique role in ensuring the future competitiveness of our business.Â 

Â 

What You Will Doâ€‹:

  • Lead the AI & Data technology roadmap and support integration into product line strategies for JADC2 solutionsÂ 

  • Collaborate with leaders across Mission Systems and beyond to integrate AI solutions into JADC2 systems and processes, and to large scale demonstrationsÂ Â 

  • Lead the establishment of objectives for execution ofâ€¯mapping and modeling of key engineering businessâ€¯process flows to optimize efficiency and meet program / DOD needsÂ 

  • Partner with divisional senior executive leadership, key stakeholders, process owners, and subjectâ€¯matter experts to identify and communicate key customer strategic initiatives/ DOD vision on Data & AIÂ 

  • Work closely with Business Development on market trends and define the technology needs required to align the portfolioÂ 

  • Lead in the definition and execution of engineering policies andâ€¯procedures that bring value to programs and insight to leadershipÂ 

  • Mentor programs leaders, customer desires, wants and needs.â€¯Â 

  • Identify and structure improvement opportunities andâ€¯projects.â€¯Advise on and help drive the business operations agendaÂ 

  • Lead cross discipline teams. Engage across disciplines to bring focus to strategic projectsâ€¯and add value and velocity to engineeringÂ 

  • Build and maintain relationships with keyâ€¯stakeholders across departments and business unitsÂ 

  • Present your ideas to internal and external groups; lead proposal and white paper activities; and represent Collins Aerospace at technical conferences and working groupsÂ Â 

  • Understand and promote key analytical projects that assist and influenceâ€¯the business. Ensure alignment with the customer program objectives.Â 

  • Be a resource for policy knowledge and provide strategic guidance on relatedâ€¯issues to leadershipÂ 

  • Active engagement with RTX Business Units and recognized as an expert externally by regulatory bodies, customers and/or universitiesÂ 

  • Provide leadership to facilitate high quality technical decisions, product competitiveness and robust solutionsÂ 

  • Engagement across the enterprise to share expertise, driving quality and success across the larger businessÂ 

  • Lead the development and execution of strategic plans to advance product technology and organizational capabilityÂ 

  • Forward looking leadership to identify potential external technology disruptors and evaluate strategic applicationsÂ 

  • Be active, visible, and engaged in external technical communities, government standards committees and shape the future of the business, particularly as it relates to emerging technology and trends in command and control in military operationsÂ 

  • Actively engaged in the attraction of top technical talent.â€¯ Build and maintain a strong talent pipelineÂ 

  • Take personal responsibility to develop, advocate and retain the next generation of technical leaders, as well as delivering enrichment opportunitiesÂ 

  • Ensure compliance with international trade policies and proceduresÂ Â 

  • Ensure the protection of Collins Aerospace intellectual property; safeguard customer and supplier/partner intellectual propertyÂ Â 

  • Selected candidate will be required to obtain and maintain special access program (SAP) clearance and/or an SCI clearanceÂ 

Â 

Qualifications You Must Have:

  • Demonstrated experience designing and implementing machine learning models and algorithms to solve business challengesÂ Â 

  • Knowledge of cybersecurity principles and their application in command and control environmentsÂ 

  • Experience with creating and maintaining directorate or organizational strategic roadmaps, customer trend analysis and disrupter technologyÂ 

  • Requires expert knowledge and mastery of multiple work areas typically obtained through advanced academic qualifications combined with experienceÂ 

  • Experience with establishing or modifying customer requirements, processes and procedures to drive positive results within the businessÂ 

  • Executive level communication skills are required, as the AI & Data Architect works within and across mission area programs to be successful and serves as the single point of contact for Engineering activitiesÂ 

  • Possess Patents, Publications, and/or Technical Presentations to industry.Â 

  • Familiarity with Earned Value Management best practices and experience in executionÂ Â 

  • Bachelorâ€™s degree (typically in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM)) and a minimum of 14 years of prior relevant experience OR Advanced Degree in a related field and minimum 12 years experience OR In absence of a degree, 18 years of relevant experience is requiredÂ Â 

  • Active and transferable DoD Secret Clearance is required prior to start dateÂ 

  • Must be a U.S. Citizen

Â 

Qualifications We Preferâ€‹:

  • Technical expert level understanding of the operational environment as it relates to relevant technologies (AI/ML, C2, and data analytics).Â Â 

  • Familiarity with simulation and modeling tools for command and control scenarios.Â Â 

  • Direct recent experience working JADC2Â Â 

  • Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud)Â Â 

  • Experience with big data technologies and data visualization toolsÂ Â 

  • Experience with cost accounting structure and financial systemsÂ 

  • Exceptional engineering analytical and decision-making skills with strong ability to be creative and innovative in designing solutionsÂ Â 

  • Experience leading and training technical teams of junior to mid-level systems engineers and analysts and ability and balance development priorities with near/long term program objectivesÂ 

  • Current Top Secret/SCI clearance is preferredÂ 

Â 

Diversity drives innovation; inclusion drives success. We believe a multitude of approaches and ideas enable us to deliver the best results for our workforce, workplace, and customers. We are committed to fostering a culture where all employees can share their passions and ideas so we can tackle the toughest challenges in our industry and pave new paths to limitless possibility.

What We Offer:

  • Medical, dental, and vision insuranceÂ Â 
  • Three weeks of vacation for newly hired employeesÂ Â 
  • Generous 401(k) plan that includes employer matching funds and separate employer retirement contribution, including a Lifetime Income Strategy optionÂ Â 
  • Tuition reimbursement programÂ 
  • Student Loan Repayment ProgramÂ Â 
  • Life insurance and disability coverageÂ Â 
  • Optional coverages you can buy pet insurance, home and auto insurance, additional life and accident insurance,â€¯critical illnessâ€¯insurance, group legal, ID theft protectionÂ 
  • Birth, adoption, parental leave benefitsÂ 
  • Ovia Health, fertility, and family planningÂ Â 
  • Adoption Assistance â€¯â€¯â€¯â€¯â€¯â€¯â€¯â€¯Â Â 
  • Autism BenefitÂ Â 
  • Employee Assistance Plan, including up to 10 free counseling sessionsÂ Â 
  • Healthy You Incentives, wellness rewards programÂ 
  • Doctor on Demand, virtual doctor visitsÂ Â 
  • Bright Horizons, child and elder care servicesÂ 
  • Teladoc Medical Experts, second opinion programÂ Â 
  • And more!â€¯Â 

Learn More & Apply Now!

The salary range for this role is 176,000 USD - 352,000 USD. The salary range provided is a good faith estimate representative of all experience levels. RTX considers several factors when extending an offer, including but not limited to, the role, function and associated responsibilities, a candidateâ€™s work experience, location, education/training, and key skills.

Hired applicants may be eligible for benefits, including but not limited to, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short-term disability, long-term disability, 401(k) match, flexible spending accounts, flexible work schedules, employee assistance program, Employee Scholar Program, parental leave, paid time off, and holidays. Specific benefits are dependent upon the specific business unit as well as whether or not the position is covered by a collective-bargaining agreement.

Hired applicants may be eligible for annual short-term and/or long-term incentive compensation programs depending on the level of the position and whether or not it is covered by a collective-bargaining agreement. Payments under these annual programs are not guaranteed and are dependent upon a variety of factors including, but not limited to, individual performance, business unit performance, and/or the companyâ€™s performance.

This role is a U.S.-based role. If the successful candidate resides in a U.S. territory, the appropriate pay structure and benefits will apply.

RTX anticipates the application window closing approximately 40 days from the date the notice was posted. However, factors such as candidate flow and business necessity may require RTX to shorten or extend the application window.

RTX is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class.
